thread.title: Johnny Heitinga moans he struggles to afford private jets
thread.title_full: Johnny Heitinga moans he struggles to afford private jets | Daily Mail Online

author: Elliott Bretland for MailOnline
title: Johnny Heitinga moans he struggles to afford private jets
text:
Former Everton centre back Johnny Heitinga claims he has had to cut back on spending and can no longer afford private jets, stylists or the fanciest villas since hanging up his boots.
The Dutchman, who also played for Ajax, Atletico Madrid, Fulham and Hertha Berlin, retired from the game in February 2016.
Heitinga, now 33, says he is now having to 'adjust' to his new life and insists he and his family no longer live the luxury lifestyle they used to enjoy.
Johnny Heitinga has moaned he is is struggling to afford the lifestyle he enjoyed as a footballer
The Dutchman, who joined Everton in 2009, hung up his boots after returning to Ajax in 2016
Heitinga and his wife Charlotte-Sophie can no longer afford private jets or personal stylists
JOHNNY HEITINGA Ajax (2001-08)
Atletico Madrid (2008-09)
Everton (2009-14)
Fulham (2014)
Hertha Berlin (2014-15)
Ajax (2015-16)
'When I was still playing football we had a lot more money coming in. Our expenditures were likewise. Now we are trying to adjust,' Heitinga said in an interview with 1limburg .
Heitinga, who earned 87 caps for the Holland national team, added that he and his wife Charlotte-Sophie - sister of former Chelsea and Liverpool star Boudewijn Zenden - miss their high-class travel.
'In the past, we sometimes chartered a private jet, but we don't do that now' he added. 'On holidays we do still rent a fancy villa, but you get different categories of 'fancy'.'
'We are trying to get used to it. Sometimes it is difficult,' said the former player's wife.
'We could not easily go to Paris, Milan or New York back then for shopping.
Shoot for @linda_magazine. Photographer ðŸ“·: @philipriches
A photo posted by @johnheitinga on Jan 17, 2017 at 11:20pm PST
The former Atletico Madrid centre back shared this image of a getaway to Ibiza in 2015
'[Our stylist Danie Bles] would do it for us. But we are now having fun doing it ourselves!'
Heitinga made 140 appearances for the Toffees, scoring five goals, and was voted the club's Player of the Season for the 2011/12 campaign by fans.
After four-and-a-half seasons on Merseyside, the defender joined Fulham in January 2014 but could not help the club avoid relegation to the Championship.
